dublin_core.dcvalue: The purpose of this paper is to review new bioterrorist and emerging infectious threats to public health in Ontario Canada and to propose a means of integrating a telephone based health information service and emergency department triage with a first line real time 24 h a day syndrome surveillance system This automated system could be beneficial in detecting a bioterrorist threat as well as in detecting and monitoring disease outbreaks such as influenza Norwalk West Nile virus Escherichia coli 0157 or severe acute respiratory syndrome
European journal of emergency medicine : official journal of the European Society for Emergency Medicine
Real-time syndrome surveillance in Ontario, Canada: the potential use of emergency departments and Telehealth.
